Package Management.GeneralManagement

Class NonAnimatedThing

java.lang.Object
Management.GeneralManagement.NonAnimatedThing
Direct Known Subclasses:
AnimatedThing
public class NonAnimatedThing extends Object
NonAnimatedThing is used to display non-interactive elements such as backgrounds.

  • Constructor Details

    • NonAnimatedThing

      public NonAnimatedThing​(String fileName, double x, double y, int width, int height, int fitWidth, int fitHeight)
      Creates a new instance of NonAnimatedThing.
      The node created will have the position (x,y) on the screen, and the size of the original image will be readjusted.
      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the file with the image of the displayed element
      x - the x coordinate of the displayed element
      y - the y coordinate of the displayed element
      width - the width of the original image
      height - the height of the original image
      fitWidth - the resized width of the displayed element
      fitHeight - the resized height of the displayed element

  • Method Details

    • getSprite

      public javafx.scene.image.ImageView getSprite()
      Returns the node of the displayed element

    • updateBackground

      public void updateBackground​(int width, int velocity, boolean twin)
      Updates the position of the NonAnimatedThing by moving it to the left.
      This method is only used to move the backgrounds of the game. Thus, we expect that each background is doubled. The second background moves the same way as the first one, but with an offset equal to their width. That way, when the first background moves, the second one moves accordingly and fills the released space. Once the first background has fully disappeared to the left, the position of both backgrounds is reset.
      Parameters:
      width - the width of the displayed element
      velocity - the speed of the displayed element
      twin - indicates if the element is the shifted twin one or not
